intro: Pedicularis lamioides, commonly known as the Lamioides lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic nature and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky slopes. Due to its specialized habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
